DataElement.preferredName: Knee Joint Knee Injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score Questionnaire Assessment Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A joint connecting the lower part of the femur with the upper part of the tibia. The lower part of the femur and the upper part of the tibia are attached to each other by ligaments. Other structures of the knee joint include the upper part of the fibula, located below and parallel to the tibia, and the patella which moves as the knee bends._A self-reported instrument to assess a patientÂ’s opinion about their knee and associated problems. It consists of 5 subscales: Pain, Function in Daily Living, Function in Sport and Recreation, Other Symptoms, and Knee Related Quality of Life._A predetermined set of questions._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.longName: Knee Injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score
Concepts.definition: A self-reported instrument to assess a patient's opinion about their knee and associated problems. It consists of 5 subscales: Pain, Function in Daily Living, Function in Sport and Recreation, Other Symptoms, and Knee Related Quality of Life.
